metadata.Title: CVE-2019-0193 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
In Apache Solr, the DataImportHandler, an optional but popular module topull in data from databases and other sources, has a feature in which thewhole DIH configuration can come from a request's "dataConfig" parameter.The debug mode of the DIH admin screen uses this to allow convenientdebugging / development of a DIH config. Since a DIH config can containscripts, this parameter is a security risk. Starting with version 8.2.0 ofSolr, use of this parameter requires setting the Java System property"enable.dih.dataConfigParam" to true.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-0193` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblucene3-contrib-java - 3.6.2+dfsg-22
liblucene3-java - 3.6.2+dfsg-22
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: lucene-solr package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.2+dfsg-22').
